definition[0]: to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words
example[0]: A laser is used to etch a pattern in the smooth surface of the disc.
example[1]: a gravestone with three names etched on it
definition[1]: if someoneâ€™s face is etched with pain, sadness etc, you can see these feelings from their expression
example[2]: Craig saw lines of pain etched around her mouth.
example[3]: Her face was etched with tiredness.
explanation[0]: Etch is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to make lines or patterns appear on something very clearly
